title: stormraiders surge never feels like it should
body:
i take stormraiders more than most... but still, to this day i dont know how to tell if it has procd. sure, there is the uber obvious "i right click then move fast" indicator, but there seems to be no sound or animation attached to it like the other masteries that have a specific instant that they proc. 

this has the result of making stormraiders FEEL less powerful than it is. also,  if i dont know the moment stormraiders succesfully procs, how do i take advantage of it if im already in melee range of my opponent? if i heard a gust of wind or something like that, i would know that NOW is the time to advance past my target to body block them or try to kite a little as a melee because i can

replies.body: Some sort of lightning animation around the feet combined with a whooshing noise maybe?

I'd probably suggest just re-using the sound that Jinx gets from getting her passive proc'd.

Grasp of the Undying and Strength of the Ages (when the healing procs at max HP stacks) already share the sound effect.
nonononono you can't reuse something that is on a champion's kit, it would create too much confusion.
#Clarity4Dayz
{{champion:28}}  with chicken smite buff next to a ward in turret range with an enemy {{champion:107}}

Why lightning? Why not windy sounds?

Don't want it to be confused with TLD
Idk I associate the storm with lightning, but wind does probably make more sense

You get a buff on your active effects bar showing Stormraider's surge.

I for one am glad that it doesn't show up so easily. If everyone knew exactly when I had extra movement speed and tenacity, they would probably run away when i'm trying to use stormraiders to outplay.
thats invis power riot wants to get rid of that
Agreed, needs some sort of sound effect or obvious visual cue as it is quite important to keep track of when fighting.
I disagree. On champions like Darius and Nasus who love to abuse Stormraiders, it's very obvious when it procs. No need to buff it any more tbh

if a darius or a nasus could use this as an advantage it would be solely because they didn't understand these mechanics intuitively before, so it would be a net benifit. highly skilled players could not abuse it any more than before, and lower skilled players have the power more accessible. smoothing out skill curves seems to be a thing riot is into these days so why not this?

+9001
this is exactly what it needs
this paired with a stronger sound seems perf tbh

Many simple.
Such effective.
Wow.

It does in fact have an audio cue, which is a sort of wooshing sound. However, it's very faint compared to other ability audios, and the nature of the sound, means it doesn't stand out very much. I have the same issue of properly reacting to whether or not I've procced it, and it often ends up with me not utilizing the effect properly which causes me to lose a trade or even dying if i was too reliant on it. I use it on Riven to trade against slow-reliant champions who use their slows to force a longer trade or chase you down(Darius, Tryndamere, Olaf, etc.), and not timing the Stromraider's Proc properly, means I'll either disengage before proccing it, thus losing the trade because I can't get away, or stay in the trade during some of the duration of the effect making it time out before I can run far enough away. This problem comes solely out of not knowing whether or not the effect has procced or not. It needs an audio cue for when the effect sets in, the current one to indicate the duration of the effect and some visual cue to go along with it.

I use it as a "if it procs, great. if it doesn't w/e" for chasing. I treat it like a random ms boost that may or may not happen so I guess it doesn't matter too much for me. For those who use it for running away though, it might be a problem

if you are just using stormraiders for the speed boost then get something else, 

you should use it for the anti-slow
Anti-slow = speed because if you're not slowed by SOMETHING in a teamfight, you're master Yi.
_sometimes surge don't feel like it should, you make it...surge so good_
There is a sound associated with it. You just don't recognize the sound.
if i dont recognise it after almost a year of using it in 1/4 of my games then it isnt a clear indicator is it?
it does make a sound. its like the wind whistling past you. but the thing is. thats so fucking quiet that you cant hear it in a actual team fight.

I have to look at my buff list. You have to be thinking about it really I guess, to remember to glance at the buff list. The best rule of thumb is that the squishier your target enemy hero is, the more often you'll accidentally activate it. At the moment, I only use it on Veigar, Varus, and sometimes Kha'zix...but I bet it's very good on someone like Renekton or Aatrox or even Udyr.

Shouldn't they do the same for Ferver?
no, fervor is  always applied when you AA, so you will always know that when you are AA'ing you are applying fervor. and your opponent also knows that if they ever push tab.

The issue with Fervor, and Deathfire Touch, is that it becomes very easy to give them the appearance of having more power than they do. Overstating power is a big no-no, because it creates a big misunderstanding for new players.

Also with Fervor/DFT it is pretty much ALWAYS in effect and you pretty much won't play around anything differently. Stormraider's Surge and TLD both are windowed abilities and thus can be played around much more than constant DPS increases.

I thiiink it looks like ghost effect, so yeah, the mere fact that I "think" that's what it looks like is proof enough that it isn't clear enough.

A sound cue or a different visual effect should be needed, because all I can see is that Nasus began sprinting after he hit me with a Q and no me gusta.
